revised_title: Wolbachia Persistence and Reversible Evolution in Cytoplasmic Incompatibility
tldr: The authors explore the dynamics of cytoplasmic incompatibility, a condition in insects where certain bacteria called Wolbachia can cause unviable offspring when two infected individuals mate. They show that Wolbachia can easily be lost from populations and discuss possible tests of this model. The study also highlights the complex mesh of unidirectional and bidirectional incompatibility in mosquitoes, which does not simply correspond to the presence or absence of Wolbachia.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Genetics and Evolution
